lines.text: Enter, in conquest, with drum and colours, EDMUND,  KING LEAR and CORDELIA, prisoners Captain, Soldiers,  and c

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Some officers take them away: good guard, Until their greater pleasures first be known That are to censure them.

lines.speaker: cordelia
lines.text: We are not the first Who, with best meaning, have incurrd the worst. For thee, oppressed king, am I cast down Myself could else outfrown false fortunes frown. Shall we not see these daughters and these sisters

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: No, no, no, no! Come, lets away to prison: We two alone will sing like birds i the cage: When thou dost ask me blessing, Ill kneel down, And ask of thee forgiveness: so well live, And pray, and sing, and tell old tales, and laugh At gilded butterflies, and hear poor rogues Talk of court news and well talk with them too, Who loses and who wins whos in, whos out And take upons the mystery of things, As if we were Gods spies: and well wear out, In a walld prison, packs and sects of great ones, That ebb and flow by the moon.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Take them away.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Upon such sacrifices, my Cordelia, The gods themselves throw incense. Have I caught thee He that parts us shall bring a brand from heaven, And fire us hence like foxes. Wipe thine eyes The goodyears shall devour them, flesh and fell, Ere they shall make us weep: well see em starve first. Come.
Exeunt KING LEAR and CORDELIA, guarded

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Come hither, captain hark. Take thou this note go follow them to prison: One step I have advanced thee if thou dost As this instructs thee, thou dost make thy way To noble fortunes: know thou this, that men Are as the time is: to be tenderminded Does not become a sword: thy great employment Will not bear question either say thoult do t, Or thrive by other means.
Giving a paper

lines.speaker: captain
lines.text: Ill do t, my lord.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: About it and write happy when thou hast done. Mark, I say, instantly and carry it so As I have set it down.

lines.speaker: captain
lines.text: I cannot draw a cart, nor eat dried oats If it be mans work, Ill do t.
Exit
Flourish. Enter ALBANY, GONERIL, REGAN, another Captain, and Soldiers

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Sir, you have shown today your valiant strain, And fortune led you well: you have the captives That were the opposites of this days strife: We do require them of you, so to use them As we shall find their merits and our safety May equally determine.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Sir, I thought it fit To send the old and miserable king To some retention and appointed guard Whose age has charms in it, whose title more, To pluck the common bosom on his side, An turn our impressd lances in our eyes Which do command them. With him I sent the queen My reason all the same and they are ready Tomorrow, or at further space, to appear Where you shall hold your session. At this time We sweat and bleed: the friend hath lost his friend And the best quarrels, in the heat, are cursed By those that feel their sharpness: The question of Cordelia and her father Requires a fitter place.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Sir, by your patience, I hold you but a subject of this war, Not as a brother.

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: Thats as we list to grace him. Methinks our pleasure might have been demanded, Ere you had spoke so far. He led our powers Bore the commission of my place and person The which immediacy may well stand up, And call itself your brother.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: Not so hot: In his own grace he doth exalt himself, More than in your addition.

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: In my rights, By me invested, he compeers the best.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: That were the most, if he should husband you.

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: Jesters do oft prove prophets.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: Holla, holla! That eye that told you so lookd but asquint.

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: Lady, I am not well else I should answer From a fullflowing stomach. General, Take thou my soldiers, prisoners, patrimony Dispose of them, of me the walls are thine: Witness the world, that I create thee here My lord and master.

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: Mean you to enjoy him

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: The letalone lies not in your good will.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Nor in thine, lord.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Halfblooded fellow, yes.

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: [To EDMUND]  Let the drum strike, and prove my title thine.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Stay yet hear reason. Edmund, I arrest thee On capital treason and, in thine attaint, This gilded serpent For your claim, fair sister, I bar it in the interest of my wife: Tis she is subcontracted to this lord, And I, her husband, contradict your bans. If you will marry, make your loves to me, My lady is bespoke.
Pointing to Goneril

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: An interlude!

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Thou art armd, Gloucester: let the trumpet sound: If none appear to prove upon thy head Thy heinous, manifest, and many treasons, There is my pledge Ill prove it on thy heart, Ere I taste bread, thou art in nothing less Than I have here proclaimd thee.
Throwing down a glove

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: Sick, O, sick!

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: [Aside]  If not, Ill neer trust medicine.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Theres my exchange: what in the world he is That names me traitor, villainlike he lies: Call by thy trumpet: he that dares approach, On him, on you, who not I will maintain My truth and honour firmly.
Throwing down a glove

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: A herald, ho!

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: A herald, ho, a herald!

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Trust to thy single virtue for thy soldiers, All levied in my name, have in my name Took their discharge.

lines.speaker: regan
lines.text: My sickness grows upon me.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: She is not well convey her to  my tent. Come hither, herald,Let the trumpet sound, And read out this.
Exit Regan, led
Enter a Herald

lines.speaker: captain
lines.text: Sound, trumpet!
A trumpet sounds

lines.speaker: herald
lines.text: [Reads]  If any man of quality or degree within the lists of the army will maintain upon Edmund, supposed Earl of Gloucester, that he is a manifold traitor, let him appear by the third sound of the trumpet: he is bold in his defence.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Sound!
First trumpet

lines.speaker: herald
lines.text: Again! Again!
Second trumpet
Third trumpet
Trumpet answers within
Enter EDGAR, at the third sound, armed, with a trumpet before him

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Ask him his purposes, why he appears Upon this call o the trumpet.

lines.speaker: herald
lines.text: What are you Your name, your quality and why you answer This present summons

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Know, my name is lost By treasons tooth baregnawn and cankerbit: Yet am I noble as the adversary I come to cope.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Which is that adversary

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Whats he that speaks for Edmund Earl of Gloucester

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Himself: what sayst thou to him

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Draw thy sword, That, if my speech offend a noble heart, Thy arm may do thee justice: here is mine. Behold, it is the privilege of mine honours, My oath, and my profession: I protest, Maugre thy strength, youth, place, and eminence, Despite thy victor sword and firenew fortune, Thy valour and thy heart, thou art a traitor False to thy gods, thy brother, and thy father Conspirant gainst this highillustrious prince And, from the extremest upward of thy head To the descent and dust below thy foot, A most toadspotted traitor. Say thou No, This sword, this arm, and my best spirits, are bent To prove upon thy heart, whereto I speak, Thou liest.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: In wisdom I should ask thy name But, since thy outside looks so fair and warlike, And that thy tongue some say of breeding breathes, What safe and nicely I might well delay By rule of knighthood, I disdain and spurn: Back do I toss these treasons to thy head With the hellhated lie oerwhelm thy heart Which, for they yet glance by and scarcely bruise, This sword of mine shall give them instant way, Where they shall rest for ever. Trumpets, speak!
Alarums. They fight. EDMUND falls

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Save him, save him!

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: This is practise, Gloucester: By the law of arms thou wast not bound to answer An unknown opposite thou art not vanquishd, But cozend and beguiled.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Shut your mouth, dame, Or with this paper shall I stop it: Hold, sir: Thou worse than any name, read thine own evil: No tearing, lady: I perceive you know it.
Gives the letter to EDMUND

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: Say, if I do, the laws are mine, not thine: Who can arraign me fort.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Most monstrous! oh! Knowst thou this paper

lines.speaker: goneril
lines.text: Ask me not what I know.
Exit

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Go after her: shes desperate govern her.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: What you have charged me with, that have I done And more, much more the time will bring it out: Tis past, and so am I. But what art thou That hast this fortune on me If thourt noble, I do forgive thee.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Lets exchange charity. I am no less in blood than thou art, Edmund If more, the more thou hast wrongd me. My name is Edgar, and thy fathers son. The gods are just, and of our pleasant vices Make instruments to plague us: The dark and vicious place where thee he got Cost him his eyes.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Thou hast spoken right, tis true The wheel is come full circle: I am here.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Methought thy very gait did prophesy A royal nobleness: I must embrace thee: Let sorrow split my heart, if ever I Did hate thee or thy father!

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Worthy prince, I knowt.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Where have you hid yourself How have you known the miseries of your father

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: By nursing them, my lord. List a brief tale And when tis told, O, that my heart would burst! The bloody proclamation to escape, That followd me so near,O, our lives sweetness! That we the pain of death would hourly die Rather than die at once!taught me to shift Into a madmans rags to assume a semblance That very dogs disdaind: and in this habit Met I my father with his bleeding rings, Their precious stones new lost: became his guide, Led him, beggd for him, saved him from despair Never,O fault!reveald myself unto him, Until some halfhour past, when I was armd: Not sure, though hoping, of this good success, I askd his blessing, and from first to last Told him my pilgrimage: but his flawd heart, Alack, too weak the conflict to support! Twixt two extremes of passion, joy and grief, Burst smilingly.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: This speech of yours hath moved me, And shall perchance do good: but speak you on You look as you had something more to say.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: If there be more, more woeful, hold it in For I am almost ready to dissolve, Hearing of this.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: This would have seemd a period To such as love not sorrow but another, To amplify too much, would make much more, And top extremity. Whilst I was big in clamour came there in a man, Who, having seen me in my worst estate, Shunnd my abhorrd society but then, finding Who twas that so endured, with his strong arms He fastened on my neck, and bellowd out As held burst heaven threw him on my father Told the most piteous tale of Lear and him That ever ear received: which in recounting His grief grew puissant and the strings of life Began to crack: twice then the trumpets sounded, And there I left him tranced.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: But who was this

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Kent, sir, the banishd Kent who in disguise Followd his enemy king, and did him service Improper for a slave.
Enter a Gentleman, with a bloody knife

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: Help, help, O, help!

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: What kind of help

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Speak, man.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: What means that bloody knife

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: Tis hot, it smokes It came even from the heart ofO, shes dead!

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Who dead speak, man.

lines.speaker: gentleman
lines.text: Your lady, sir, your lady: and her sister By her is poisoned she hath confessd it.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: I was contracted to them both: all three Now marry in an instant.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Here comes Kent.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Produce their bodies, be they alive or dead: This judgment of the heavens, that makes us tremble, Touches us not with pity. O, is this he The time will not allow the compliment Which very manners urges.
Exit Gentleman
Enter KENT

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: I am come To bid my king and master aye good night: Is he not here

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Great thing of us forgot! Speak, Edmund, wheres the king and wheres Cordelia Seest thou this object, Kent
The bodies of GONERIL and REGAN are brought in

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: Alack, why thus

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Yet Edmund was beloved: The one the other poisond for my sake, And after slew herself.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Even so. Cover their faces.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: I pant for life: some good I mean to do, Despite of mine own nature. Quickly send, Be brief in it, to the castle for my writ Is on the life of Lear and on Cordelia: Nay, send in time.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Run, run, O, run!

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: To who, my lord Who hath the office send Thy token of reprieve.

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: Well thought on: take my sword, Give it the captain.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Haste thee, for thy life.
Exit EDGAR

lines.speaker: edmund
lines.text: He hath commission from thy wife and me To hang Cordelia in the prison, and To lay the blame upon her own despair, That she fordid herself.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: The gods defend her! Bear him hence awhile.
EDMUND is borne off
Reenter KING LEAR, with CORDELIA dead in his arms EDGAR, Captain, and others following

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Howl, howl, howl, howl! O, you are men of stones: Had I your tongues and eyes, Ild use them so That heavens vault should crack. Shes gone for ever! I know when one is dead, and when one lives Shes dead as earth. Lend me a lookingglass If that her breath will mist or stain the stone, Why, then she lives.

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: Is this the promised end

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Or image of that horror

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Fall, and cease!

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: This feather stirs she lives! if it be so, It is a chance which does redeem all sorrows That ever I have felt.

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: [Kneeling]  O my good master!

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Prithee, away.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Tis noble Kent, your friend.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: A plague upon you, murderers, traitors all! I might have saved her now shes gone for ever! Cordelia, Cordelia! stay a little. Ha! What ist thou sayst Her voice was ever soft, Gentle, and low, an excellent thing in woman. I killd the slave that was ahanging thee.

lines.speaker: captain
lines.text: Tis true, my lords, he did.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Did I not, fellow I have seen the day, with my good biting falchion I would have made them skip: I am old now, And these same crosses spoil me. Who are you Mine eyes are not o the best: Ill tell you straight.

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: If fortune brag of two she loved and hated, One of them we behold.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: This is a dull sight. Are you not Kent

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: The same, Your servant Kent: Where is your servant Caius

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Hes a good fellow, I can tell you that Hell strike, and quickly too: hes dead and rotten.

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: No, my good lord I am the very man,

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Ill see that straight.

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: That, from your first of difference and decay, Have followd your sad steps.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: You are welcome hither.

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: Nor no man else: alls cheerless, dark, and deadly. Your eldest daughters have fordone them selves, And desperately are dead.

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: Ay, so I think.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: He knows not what he says: and vain it is That we present us to him.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Very bootless.
Enter a Captain

lines.speaker: captain
lines.text: Edmund is dead, my lord.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Thats but a trifle here. You lords and noble friends, know our intent. What comfort to this great decay may come Shall be applied: for us we will resign, During the life of this old majesty, To him our absolute power: you, to your rights: With boot, and such addition as your honours Have more than merited. All friends shall taste The wages of their virtue, and all foes The cup of their deservings. O, see, see!
To EDGAR and KENT

lines.speaker: king lear
lines.text: And my poor fool is hangd! No, no, no life! Why should a dog, a horse, a rat, have life, And thou no breath at all Thoult come no more, Never, never, never, never, never! Pray you, undo this button: thank you, sir. Do you see this Look on her, look, her lips, Look there, look there!
Dies

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: He faints! My lord, my lord!

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: Break, heart I prithee, break!

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: Look up, my lord.

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: Vex not his ghost: O, let him pass! he hates him much That would upon the rack of this tough world Stretch him out longer.

lines.speaker: edgar
lines.text: He is gone, indeed.

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: The wonder is, he hath endured so long: He but usurpd his life.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: Bear them from hence. Our present business Is general woe. Friends of my soul, you twain Rule in this realm, and the gored state sustain.
To KENT and EDGAR

lines.speaker: kent
lines.text: I have a journey, sir, shortly to go My master calls me, I must not say no.

lines.speaker: albany
lines.text: The weight of this sad time we must obey Speak what we feel, not what we ought to say. The oldest hath borne most: we that are young Shall never see so much, nor live so long.
Exeunt, with a dead march
